{"step_by_step_thinking": "L-asparaginase is a chemotherapy drug that is used to treat certain types of cancer. It works by breaking down asparagine, an amino acid that is necessary for cell growth, in the body. This is particularly effective in treating cancers that cannot produce this amino acid on their own. Among the options given, Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia (ALL) is the type of cancer that is most commonly treated with L-asparaginase.", "answer_choice": "B. ALL"}
